titleInfo.title: Betty L. Johnson oral history interview

subject.geographic: Wesley United Methodist Church (Baton Rouge, La.)

mods.abstract: Johnson describes her experiences as a congregant of Wesley United Methodist Church. She discusses the church's history and musical traditions, their support of higher education and partnerships with local universities, activities and retreats for church members, community outreach programs, involvement in the Civil Rights Movement and other topics. She talks about prominent former ministers, members and visitors to the church, and the role of women at Wesley.
mods.note: This collection includes materials accessioned as Mss. 4700.0896; A digital version of the transcript (pdf) exists for duplication purposes; A digital version of the audio recording (mp3) exists for duplication purposes and public access in the Special Collections Reading Room; Interview conducted by Toni Morrison.

Betty Johnson was born in April 1929 in Baton Rouge, La., to Thelma Ambeau Johnson and George E. Johnson Jr. She is a longtime member of Wesley United Methodist Church and at the time of this interview, was employed as an academic counselor at Southern University.
